name: Aberdour Silver Sands Beach
description: Award-winning sandy beach on the Fife coast with stunning views of Inchcolm Island and its famous 12th-century abbey. Holding the Keep Scotland Beautiful Beach Award for 30 consecutive years and VisitScotland 4-Star Quality Assurance Award. Features soft white sand, excellent water quality, and RNLI lifeguard cover during summer. Beachfront café, toilets, first aid, picnic areas, putting green. The Fife Coastal Path passes by. Dogs restricted April-September on main beach but allowed year-round on adjacent Black Sands. 10-minute walk from Aberdour train station.

name: Adventure Planet Softplay
description: Indoor soft play centre with multi-level frames, slides, ball pools, and toddler areas. Meal deal includes entry and food. Café serves hot meals and snacks. Party packages available. Suitable for babies to age 12.

name: Aerial Adventures
description: Indoor soft play with multi-level frames, slides, ball pits, and sports activities. Separate areas for different ages. Café on-site. Accessible facilities. Popular for parties.

name: Almond Valley Heritage Centre
description: Family farm attraction and heritage centre set across 40 acres. Working farm with sheep, pigs, goats, cattle, and poultry. Indoor museum exploring West Lothian's shale oil heritage with interactive displays. Features indoor soft play, outdoor adventure playground, tractor rides, nature trail, and 500m narrow-gauge railway. Mill Farm Café. Museum of the Scottish Shale Oil Industry (collection of national significance). Seasonal activities include lambing, pond dipping. All-weather attraction. Dogs welcome outdoors. Allow 3-4 hours.

name: Almondell & Calderwood Country Park
location: Between Broxburn and East Calder, West Lothian
description: Beautiful 220-acre country park hidden in River Almond valley. Created from two historic estates with 340-million-year history. Scenic woodland and riverside walks with bridges. Calderwood is ancient SSSI woodland with roe deer, foxes, herons, otters, woodpeckers, red squirrels. Spring bluebells and fungi displays. Visitor Centre (former stable block) with displays, aquarium, gallery, conservatory café. National Cycle Route 75 runs through. Activities: walking, cycling, horse riding, BBQ (booking required). Popular with families and geocachers. Free parking at four locations. 4-star VisitScotland.
opening_hours: Park: 24/7. Visitor Centre: Summer 9am-5pm, Winter 10am-4pm (closed 25-26 Dec, 1-2 Jan)

name: Amazonia @ M&D's
price: Adults £6.20, Children (3-14) £4.75, Under 3s FREE (£1 Mon-Thu after 3pm)
description: Scotland's only indoor tropical rainforest featuring exotic South American animals including marmosets, sloths, reptiles, tropical birds, and butterflies. Climate-controlled rainforest habitat with educational displays about ecosystems and conservation. Part of M&D's Theme Park complex. Can combine with theme park rides, Cosmic Bowl, adventure golf. Special weekday afternoon discount. Wheelchair accessible. Allow 1-2 hours.

name: Aquatec Leisure Centre
description: Modern leisure centre offering swimming pools, fitness facilities, and activity programmes. Main pool, learner pool, and sports facilities. Popular for family swimming sessions and children's activities.

name: Ardardan Estate
description: Historic estate with woodland walks, riverside trails, and spectacular River Clyde views. Hosts seasonal events: nature walks, outdoor theatre, craft fairs, family activities. Working estate with farming. Dogs welcome on leads. Free general access for walking.
opening_hours: Grounds open dawn to dusk. Event times vary

name: Arnprior Farm
price: Prices vary by activity and season
description: Seasonal farm attraction offering pumpkin picking in autumn, lambing experiences in spring, and farm activities throughout the year. Family-friendly farm with opportunities to meet animals and enjoy outdoor activities. Popular for seasonal events and educational farm visits.
opening_hours: Seasonal - check for opening dates and times

name: Auchingarrich Wildlife Centre
price: Under 2s FREE, prices vary by age
description: Family-run wildlife park featuring farm animals, exotic birds, reptiles, and small mammals. Large outdoor adventure play area with climbing frames and slides. Indoor soft play for younger children. Meet and feed friendly animals including alpacas, goats, pigs, and rabbits. Bird of prey flying displays. Picnic areas throughout. Café serving hot food and snacks. Allow 2-3 hours.

name: Ayr Beach
description: Long sandy beach stretching for 2.5 miles along Ayr's coastline. Popular for walks, paddling, and beach games. Esplanade with cafés, ice cream shops, and amusements nearby. Ayr is a traditional Scottish seaside town with links to Robert Burns. Beach accessible from town centre. Dogs welcome year-round with some seasonal restrictions.

name: Badminton For You - Adventure Bouncy Castles
description: Indoor bouncy castle and sports activity centre. Features large inflatable play areas, bouncy castles, and badminton facilities. Suitable for energetic play and parties. Indoor venue perfect for rainy days.

name: Balloch Country Park
description: Beautiful country park on the southern shores of Loch Lomond, gateway to the Loch Lomond & The Trossachs National Park. Features loch-side walks, tree trails, woodland paths, and sandy play park. Excellent picnic areas with spectacular loch views. Visitor centre with information about the national park. Adjacent to Loch Lomond Shores shopping and leisure complex. Popular for walks, wildlife watching, and family outings. Dogs welcome throughout.

name: Baltic Street Adventure Playground
description: Community adventure playground providing free outdoor play for children. Features climbing structures, swings, and creative play areas. Supervised sessions available. Popular local facility for active outdoor play.

name: Baron's Haugh Nature Reserve
description: RSPB nature reserve beside the River Clyde featuring wetland habitats, woodlands, and meadows. Excellent for birdwatching with hides overlooking ponds and marshes. Home to kingfishers, herons, warblers, and seasonal migrants. Network of paths suitable for gentle walks. Educational displays about local wildlife. Free entry. Dogs not permitted to protect ground-nesting birds.

name: Barshaw Park
description: Popular 55-acre public park featuring duck pond, miniature railway (seasonal, small charge), play areas, and small animal enclosure with rabbits, guinea pigs, and chickens. Beautiful gardens, woodland walks, and open green spaces. Model railway operates weekends and holidays. Perfect for family picnics and leisurely walks. Dogs welcome throughout park.
opening_hours: Park open dawn to dusk. Railway operates seasonally

name: Bearsden Ski Club
description: Artificial ski slope offering skiing and snowboarding lessons and practice year-round. Suitable for beginners to advanced skiers. Indoor and outdoor facilities. Equipment hire available. Popular for ski lessons and maintaining skills between winter seasons.
opening_hours: Check for session times and bookings

name: Beech Tree Inn
description: Family-friendly country pub and restaurant at the foot of Dumgoyne Hill. Features outdoor play area with farm animals for children. Indoor and outdoor seating. Popular stop for walkers tackling the West Highland Way. Serves traditional pub food and local ales. Beautiful countryside setting with views. Dogs welcome in outdoor areas.
opening_hours: Daily - check for food service times

name: Beecraigs Country Park
description: 913-acre country park with mixed woodland and moorland. Features red deer park, archery centre (charges apply), orienteering courses, mountain bike trails, and loch for fishing (permit required). Trim trail fitness stations, children's play area, and barbecue sites (bookable). Trout farm with fishing opportunities. Multiple marked walks from easy to challenging. Popular with mountain bikers, walkers, and families. Visitor centre with café. One of three West Lothian country parks.
opening_hours: Park open dawn to dusk. Visitor centre hours vary

name: Bellahouston Park
description: Large 71-hectare public park in Glasgow's south side featuring sports facilities, play areas, and the iconic House for an Art Lover (designed by Charles Rennie Mackintosh, entry charge). Hosts annual events including Glasgow Mela cultural festival. Excellent cycling and walking paths. Children's play areas. Dogs welcome throughout. Home to Glasgow Ski Centre (dry slope).

name: Bishopbriggs Park Fairy Trail
description: Woodland park featuring enchanting fairy trail with carved wooden sculptures hidden among the trees. Children love searching for fairy doors, houses, and characters along the path. Pleasant walks through mature woodland. Local community park perfect for short family outings. Free entry and parking.

name: Blair Drummond Safari & Adventure Park
price: Adults from £21.95, Children 3-14 from £16.95, Under 3s FREE
description: Scotland's premier safari park set on 160 acres, home to over 300 animals including Scotland's only giraffes, lions, rhinos, elephants, and tigers. Drive through animal reserves in your own car, brave the famous Macaque monkey drive-through, walk with lemurs in Lemur Land. Features spectacular bird of prey displays, sea lion demonstrations, permanent dinosaur exhibit with life-sized moving models. Adventure play areas with giant fort and pirate ship, pedal boats, go-karts, astroglide. Open mid-March to end December. Online booking only - no gate sales. Wheelchair accessible with viewing ramps and Changing Places toilet. Allow 3-4 hours minimum.

name: Bo'ness & Kinneil Railway
description: Scotland's premier heritage railway operating steam and diesel trains along a scenic 5-mile route. Journey from Bo'ness to Manuel or Birkhill through beautiful countryside. Features working railway museum, engine shed, and collection of historic locomotives and carriages. Thomas the Tank Engine events and special themed days throughout year. Popular with train enthusiasts and families. Station café and gift shop.
opening_hours: Operating days vary - typically weekends Easter to October, plus special events

name: Boswell's Coach House
description: Heritage visitor attraction featuring small play area, woodland walks, and castle ruins. Coffee shop serving refreshments. Historical connection to James Boswell, biographer of Samuel Johnson. Quiet family attraction with mix of indoor and outdoor features. Free entry to grounds and ruins.
opening_hours: Grounds open daily. Café hours vary

name: Bounce & Tag Active
description: Indoor trampoline park and active play centre. Features trampolines, dodgeball courts, foam pits, and tag arenas. High-energy activities for children and adults. Popular for parties and group bookings. Café on-site.

name: Briarlands Farm
description: Family farm attraction with friendly farm animals to meet and feed. Indoor and outdoor play areas. Tractor rides, animal handling sessions. Seasonal activities. Café serving snacks and hot food. Popular for birthday parties. Under 3s enter free.

name: Broadwood Stadium Gym Play
description: Sports facility offering gym play sessions for children. Indoor active play in safe environment. Part of Broadwood Stadium leisure complex. Suitable for energetic indoor activities.

name: Burngreen Park
description: Local community park with play area and green space. Good for family outings and children's play. Free entry and parking.

name: Burntisland Beach & Town
description: Award-winning sandy beach (Keep Scotland Beautiful Seaside Award) on Fife coast overlooking Firth of Forth. Extensive sands with rock pools, backed by promenade, Links park, and traditional fairground (summer). Beacon Leisure Centre nearby with 25m pool, wave machine, flumes. Crazy golf, bouncy castles (seasonal). Historic town with 16th-century Parish Church, 12th-century Rossend Castle. Fife Coastal Path passes through. At low tide can walk to Kinghorn. Annual Highland Games (July - second oldest in world). Dogs welcome year-round. Lifeguards in peak summer. Train station nearby with direct Edinburgh links.

name: Café Ceramico
description: Pottery painting café where families can paint ceramics. Choose from plates, mugs, figurines. Prices based on item chosen. Café serves refreshments. Popular for creative rainy day activities and parties. Pieces fired and ready for collection within a week.

name: Cairnie Fruit Farm & Maze
price: Under 3s FREE, prices vary by activity
description: Family farm open March to October featuring maize maze (summer/autumn), fruit picking (strawberries, raspberries), farm animals, and play areas. Seasonal activities change throughout year. Café serves home-baking and light meals. Popular for family days out and pick-your-own fruit. Under 3s free entry.

name: Calderglen Country Park
price: FREE park entry (zoo 50p children, FREE adults)
description: Popular 85-acre country park featuring woodland walks, Rotten Calder Water gorge, ornamental gardens, and children's zoo (50p entry for children). Zoo houses meerkats, owls, otters, and exotic birds. Excellent adventure playground, toddler play area, nature trails. Conservatory and visitor centre with displays. Seasonal events throughout year. Dogs welcome in park (not in zoo). Beautiful spot for family picnics and walks.
opening_hours: Park open dawn to dusk. Zoo 10am-dusk

name: Callendar Park
description: Historic 170-acre parkland surrounding Callendar House. Features woodland walks, ornamental gardens, play areas, and pitch & putt. Callendar House itself has free museum displays about local history and Antonine Wall (small charge for special exhibitions). Excellent children's play area. Beautiful parkland with mature trees. Popular for walks, picnics, and outdoor activities. Dogs welcome throughout.
opening_hours: Park open dawn to dusk. Callendar House: Mon-Sat 10am-5pm, Sun 11am-5pm

name: Camera Obscura & World of Illusions
price: Prices vary - book online for best rates
description: Edinburgh's oldest purpose-built tourist attraction (since 1835) featuring over 100 interactive exhibits across 5 floors. Victorian rooftop camera obscura offers live 360° views of Edinburgh. Optical illusions, mirror maze, vortex tunnel, holograms. Fantastic views from rooftop terrace. Popular rainy day attraction. Allow 1.5-2 hours. Located on Royal Mile near Edinburgh Castle. Pre-booking recommended.

name: Campsie Glen Gallery & Café
description: Art gallery and café in scenic location near Campsie Fells. Features local artwork and crafts. Café serves home-baking, light lunches, and refreshments. Starting point for Campsie Glen walks to waterfalls. Popular stop for walkers and visitors to the area.

name: Carmichael Estate
description: Historic estate with woodland walks, gardens, and occasional events. Features beautiful grounds with mature trees and peaceful walking trails. Hosts seasonal events including plant sales and garden tours. Quiet rural location perfect for leisurely walks.
opening_hours: Grounds open daily. Estate events vary

name: Castle Semple Country Park
description: Beautiful 100-acre country park centered around Castle Semple Loch. Excellent for water sports including sailing, kayaking, canoeing (equipment hire available). Circular walking trails, cycle paths, and play areas. Visitor centre with café and watersports centre. Popular with families, cyclists, and water sports enthusiasts. RSPB nature reserve nearby. Dogs welcome.
opening_hours: Park open dawn to dusk. Visitor centre hours vary

name: Chatelherault Country Park
description: 500-acre woodland country park with 18th-century hunting lodge (Chatelherault) designed by William Adam. Extensive woodland walks through ancient Cadzow Forest. White Cadzow cattle (ancient breed dating back centuries) roam parkland. Ornamental gardens, adventure playground, and Duke's Bridge over Avon Gorge. Visitor centre with exhibitions about the park's history. Excellent network of trails for all abilities. Dogs welcome throughout. Popular with walkers, families, and nature lovers.

name: Cineworld & Odeon Kids Club
price: Low cost kids screenings (check individual cinemas)
description: Weekend morning kids clubs at Cineworld and Odeon cinemas showing family films at reduced prices. Usually Saturday and Sunday mornings. Great value entertainment for families. Check local cinema for screening times and films. Most cinemas fully accessible.
opening_hours: Weekend mornings - check local cinema schedules

name: City Kids Adventure Play
description: Indoor play centre featuring multi-level play frames, slides, ball pools, and soft play areas. Dedicated toddler zone. Café serving hot food and refreshments. Party packages available. Popular rainy day destination for families.

name: City Sightseeing Tour Bus
price: Adults and children prices vary - check website
description: Open-top hop-on hop-off bus tour of Glasgow covering major attractions. Live or recorded commentary. Covers city centre, West End, Riverside Museum, SSE Hydro, and more. Tours run every 20-30 minutes. Tickets valid for 1-2 days. Great introduction to the city. Covered upper deck for rainy weather.

name: Clark's Little Ark
description: Small animal attraction featuring friendly farm animals including alpacas, goats, pigs, rabbits. Children can meet and interact with animals. Free entry making it excellent value. Lovely rural setting. Popular with families visiting Dumfries & Galloway.

name: Coats Observatory
description: Historic observatory (oldest public observatory in Scotland) offering astronomy displays, meteorological instruments, and telescope viewing sessions. Small museum with scientific instruments. Regular evening telescope viewing (weather permitting). Educational displays about astronomy and weather. Free entry. Great for science-interested families.
opening_hours: Tue-Sat 10am-1pm, 2pm-5pm. Evening telescope sessions by arrangement

name: Cocoa Bean Company
description: Artisan chocolate maker offering workshops and chocolate-making experiences. Learn to make truffles, bars, and decorations. Shop sells handmade chocolates. Popular rainy day activity in this pretty harbour town.

name: Cocoabean Chocolate Factory
description: Chocolate-making experiences and workshops. Watch chocolatiers at work, decorate chocolates, or take workshop classes. Popular for children's parties and family activities. Shop sells handmade chocolates and gifts. Located in Braehead shopping centre. Accessible facilities.

name: Colzium Estate
description: Historic 60-acre estate with walled garden, ornamental gardens, arboretum, and woodland walks. Visitor centre houses museum and café. Children's play area. Theatre hosts events and performances. Unique curling pond museum. Ice cream parlour. Beautiful grounds for walks and picnics. Dogs welcome. Free parking.
opening_hours: Grounds open dawn to dusk. Visitor centre hours vary

name: Conifox Adventure Play Park
price: Under 2s FREE, prices vary by age
description: Large adventure play park set in woodland with indoor and outdoor play areas. Outdoor features include slides, climbing frames, zip wires, trampolines. Indoor soft play for all weather. Café serves hot food and snacks. Popular for parties. Under 2s free entry. Allow 2-3 hours.

name: Coopers Coffees
description: Family-run coffee shop offering children's baking and biscuit decorating workshops. Kids can make and decorate their own treats. Café serves coffee, cakes, and light meals. Popular activity for children's parties and rainy days. Pre-booking usually required.

name: Craft Daft
description: Arts and crafts studio offering pottery painting, canvas painting, and other creative activities. Choose from ceramics, canvases, or craft projects. Prices based on items chosen. Café serves refreshments. Popular for parties and creative rainy day activities.

name: Craft Daft on a Raft
description: Pottery painting and crafts studio on converted canal barge. Unique venue offering ceramic painting, crafts, and creative activities. Café serves refreshments. Popular for parties and rainy day activities. Quirky canalside location.

name: Craigend Nursery Indoor Sandpit
description: Indoor sandpit play facility perfect for younger children. Clean indoor sand play with toys and equipment. Great rainy day activity for toddlers and preschoolers.

name: Craigie's Farm Shop & Pick Your Own
description: Family farm offering pick-your-own fruit (strawberries, raspberries) in season. Farm shop sells fresh produce, baked goods, and local products. Outdoor play area for children. Maize maze in summer/autumn. Café serves farm-fresh food. Popular seasonal destination. Dogs not permitted in pick-your-own areas.

name: Craignethan Castle
description: Impressive 16th-century tower house perched above the River Nethan. One of Scotland's finest Renaissance fortifications. Explore ramparts, towers, and underground caponier (unique artillery defence). Beautiful rural setting with woodland walks. Managed by Historic Environment Scotland. Under 5s free. Excellent for history enthusiasts.
opening_hours: April-September (check HES website for exact dates)

name: Craigtoun Country Park
description: Beautiful 50-acre country park near St Andrews featuring miniature railway, paddle boats, crazy golf, Dutch Village, and children's play areas. Ornamental gardens, woodland walks, and large boating pond. Parkland free but attractions have small charges. Tearoom serves refreshments. Popular family destination. Dogs welcome in park (not on attractions).
opening_hours: Park open daily. Attractions open Easter-September

name: Crawick Multiverse
description: Unique land art project on former opencast mine transformed by sculptor Charles Jencks. Features cosmic sculptures, stone circles, pyramids, and landforms inspired by astronomy. 55 acres of striking landscape art. Excellent for walking with spectacular sculptural views. Pre-booking required. Dogs welcome. Wear sturdy footwear. Allow 1.5-2 hours.

name: Cream o' Galloway
location: Near Gatehouse of Fleet, Dumfries & Galloway
price: Under 3s FREE, prices vary by activity
description: Organic dairy farm with adventure playground, nature trails, indoor play area, and ice cream parlour. Famous for delicious organic ice cream made on-site. Large outdoor adventure playground, woodland walks, nature trail with sculptures. Indoor play barn for rainy weather. Visitor centre with exhibitions. Café serves homemade food. Under 3s free. Popular family destination. Allow 2-3 hours.

name: Crieff Hydro
description: Large resort hotel offering day visitor activities including swimming pools, soft play, archery, zip wire, horse riding, cinema, and more. 60+ activities available. Some activities require pre-booking. Popular for both hotel stays and day visits. Excellent facilities in beautiful Perthshire setting. Activities suitable for all ages.
opening_hours: Resort facilities daily - activity times vary

name: Culzean Castle & Country Park
price: Adults and children charged (National Trust members free)
description: Spectacular clifftop castle and 600-acre country park. Robert Adam-designed 18th-century castle with impressive interiors. Grounds feature swan pond, walled garden, adventure playground, woodland walks, and deer park. Stunning coastal location with beaches and caves. Visitor centre and cafés. Dogs welcome in grounds (not castle). National Trust for Scotland property. Allow 3-4 hours. One of Scotland's finest country estates.
opening_hours: Country park open daily 9:30am-sunset. Castle seasonal

name: Cuningar Loop Woodland Park
description: Urban woodland park created for Commonwealth Games 2014. Features BMX pump track, walking/cycling paths, woodland trails, and River Clyde views. Play areas for children. Popular with cyclists, dog walkers, and families. Fully accessible paths. Community growing spaces. Great example of urban regeneration.

name: Dalgarven Mill Museum
description: Working water-powered mill and Museum of Ayrshire Country Life & Costume. Explore rural life through ages with displays of farming equipment, domestic items, and traditional costumes. Working mill machinery demonstrations. Gift shop and tearoom. Educational visits popular with schools and families interested in local history.

name: Dalkeith Country Park
price: FREE park entry (Fort Douglas playpark: under 3s & adults FREE, children charged)
description: Beautiful 1,000-acre estate with woodland walks, riverside paths along River North Esk and River South Esk. Fort Douglas adventure playground (entry charged for children). 12 miles of pathways, Tudor-style stable courtyard with shops and restaurant. Restored 18th-century bridge, tunnel walk. Popular for walking, cycling, horse riding. Dogs welcome throughout park (not in Fort Douglas). Allow 2-3 hours minimum.

name: Dalscone Farm Fun
description: Family farm attraction with indoor and outdoor play areas, farm animals to meet and feed, tractor rides, go-karts, trampolines. Indoor soft play for rainy spells. Café serves hot food. Popular for birthday parties. Seasonal activities throughout year.

name: Dams to Darnley Country Park
description: Green corridor connecting reservoirs and countryside on Glasgow's southern edge. Network of walking and cycling paths through varied landscapes. Good for wildlife watching, particularly around the reservoirs. Popular with dog walkers, cyclists, and ramblers. Part of wider Seven Lochs Wetland Park vision.

name: David Coulthard Museum
description: Small museum dedicated to Formula 1 driver David Coulthard, who grew up locally. Racing memorabilia, trophies, cars, and personal items. Interesting for motorsport fans. Located in picturesque harbour town of Kirkcudbright.

name: David Livingstone Birthplace Museum
description: Museum dedicated to explorer and missionary David Livingstone. Set in restored tenement where he was born. Interactive displays about his African explorations and Victorian working-class life. Woodland walks along River Clyde. Play areas. Managed by National Trust for Scotland. Café on-site.

name: Dean Castle Country Park
description: Beautiful 200-acre country park surrounding 14th-century Dean Castle. Features woodlands, riverside walks, children's play areas, visitor centre, and animal collection. Castle houses arms and armour collection and early musical instruments. Ranger-led activities. Popular for walks, picnics, and family days out. Dogs welcome in park.
opening_hours: Park open dawn to dusk. Castle and visitor centre hours vary

name: Deep Sea World
price: Adults £17.50, Children 3-12 £12.75, Under 3s FREE, Family ticket (2+2) £58.50
description: Scotland's National Aquarium located beneath the Forth Rail Bridge. Features one of world's longest underwater viewing tunnels at 112 metres, holding 1 million gallons of seawater with Europe's largest collection of sand tiger sharks. Over 40 displays include piranhas, resident seals, seahorses, stingrays, tropical fish, and rare Angel Shark. Interactive feeding times and educational talks throughout day. Built in former quarry. Allow 2-3 hours. Shark diving experiences available. Wheelchair and mobility scooter friendly with ramps. Free carers pass with NHS ID.
opening_hours: Daily 10am-5pm, closed Christmas and New Year

name: Dhoon Beach
description: Quiet sandy beach on the Solway Coast. Rock pools to explore at low tide. Beautiful coastal scenery with views across Solway Firth. Less busy than some beaches, perfect for peaceful walks. Dogs welcome year-round. Good for beachcombing and wildlife watching.

name: Dino Park
description: Indoor soft play centre with dinosaur theme. Multi-level play frames, slides, ball pools, and dedicated toddler area. Café serves hot food and snacks. Popular for parties. Under 2s free entry. Good rainy day option.

name: DinoM8
description: Large indoor soft play centre with multi-level play frames, slides, ball pools, and sports area. Dinosaur themed décor. Separate toddler area. Café serves hot meals and snacks. Party packages available. Accessible facilities. Popular rainy day destination.

name: Doune Castle
price: Adults and children charged, under 5s FREE
description: Magnificent 14th-century medieval castle, one of Scotland's best-preserved. Famous filming location for Monty Python and the Holy Grail, Game of Thrones, and Outlander. Audio guide narrated by Monty Python's Terry Jones. Impressive great hall and towers. Beautiful riverside setting. Managed by Historic Environment Scotland. Under 5s free.

name: Drumlanrig Castle & Country Estate
price: Adults and children charged, under 5s FREE
description: Stunning 17th-century castle with pink sandstone façade. Home to Duke of Buccleuch and Queensberry. Famous art collection including works by Rembrandt, Leonardo da Vinci. Beautiful gardens, woodland walks, adventure playground, working forge, and gift shops. Cycle trails. Tearoom and restaurant. Under 5s free. Allow 3-4 hours.

name: Drumpellier Country Park
description: Large 500-acre country park centered around Woodend Loch and Lochend Loch. Excellent for walking, cycling, fishing (permit required). Visitor centre with café. Children's play area. Golf course. Nature reserve with varied birdlife. Accessible paths around lochs. Dogs welcome. Popular with local families and walkers.
opening_hours: Park open 24/7. Visitor centre hours vary

name: Dumbarton Castle
description: Historic fortress perched on volcanic rock overlooking River Clyde. Scotland's longest fortified site with 1,500 years of history. Spectacular panoramic views from summit. Climb steep path to explore castle remains and artillery fortifications. Visitor centre with exhibitions. Managed by Historic Environment Scotland. Stunning riverside location.

name: Dumfries House
price: Entry fees apply - guided tours required
description: Magnificent 18th-century Palladian mansion saved by Prince Charles. Contains world's most important collection of Thomas Chippendale furniture in original setting. Beautiful gardens, adventure playground, café, and gift shop. Guided tours of house. Extensive estate grounds for walking. Dogs welcome in gardens. Exceptional historic house experience.
opening_hours: Check website for tour times and booking

name: Duncarron Medieval Village
description: Authentic reconstruction of medieval Scottish village circa 1300s. Built entirely by volunteers using period-appropriate techniques and materials. Explore buildings including great hall, houses, smithy, chapel. Living history events with costumed interpreters. Educational and fascinating for history enthusiasts. Unique attraction. Pre-booking essential.

name: Dundonald Castle
price: Adults and children charged, under 5s FREE
description: Impressive hilltop castle built by Robert II in late 1300s. Scotland's earliest stone castle. Climb tower for panoramic views across Ayrshire. Visitor centre with interactive displays and audio-visual presentation. Costumed guides in summer. Under 5s free. Managed by Historic Environment Scotland.

name: Dynamic Earth
price: Adults from £17.50, Children 3-15 from £11, Under 3s FREE
description: Interactive science centre telling story of planet Earth from Big Bang to present. Journey through time experiencing volcanic eruptions, tropical rainforests, polar ice caps, and deep oceans. Features 360° ShowDome, 4D experience, and hands-on exhibits about climate, oceans, and space. Educational and entertaining for all ages. Located beneath Salisbury Crags next to Scottish Parliament. Allow 2-3 hours.

name: East Links Family Park
price: Under 2s FREE, prices vary by age
description: Coastal family attraction with indoor and outdoor play areas. Features JCB zone, pedal tractors, bouncy pillows, adventure playground, and animal handling. Mini farm with goats, rabbits, guinea pigs. Café serves hot food. Popular day out for families with young children. Under 2s free.

name: East Yonderton Pick Your Own Fruit
description: Pick-your-own fruit farm offering seasonal strawberries, raspberries, and other soft fruits. Popular summer activity. Pay by weight for fruit picked. Check opening dates as depends on growing season.

name: Edenmill Farm Shop & Play Barn
description: Farm shop with soft play barn. 2-hour play sessions combined with food. Large indoor play area with slides, ball pools, and climbing frames. Farm shop sells fresh produce and baked goods. Café serves hot meals and snacks. Adults free. Popular for toddlers and young children.

name: Edinburgh Castle
description: Scotland's most visited paid attraction. Historic fortress dominating Edinburgh skyline from Castle Rock. Crown Jewels (Honours of Scotland), Stone of Destiny, National War Museum, Great Hall, St Margaret's Chapel (oldest building in Edinburgh), Mons Meg cannon, Royal Palace, Prisons of War. One O'Clock Gun fired daily (except Sundays, Christmas, Good Friday). Spectacular views over Edinburgh. Allow 2-3 hours. Pre-book online to guarantee entry and save money. Managed by Historic Environment Scotland.
opening_hours: Apr-Sep: 9:30am-6pm; Oct-Mar: 9:30am-5pm (last entry 1hr before closing), Closed 25-26 Dec

name: Edinburgh Zoo
price: Adults from £20, Children 3-15 from £15, Under 3s FREE
description: Scotland's premier zoo home to over 2,500 rare and endangered animals including giant pandas, penguins, koalas, tigers, and lions. Part of Royal Zoological Society of Scotland focusing on conservation and breeding programmes. Set on 82-acre hillside site with spectacular Edinburgh views. Daily keeper talks and feeding times. Brilliant Birds show features free-flying birds. Hilltop Safari takes visitors to highest point. Play areas throughout. Book online in advance for best prices. Allow 3-4 hours.

name: Eglinton Country Park
description: Large 400-hectare country park with woodland walks, open parkland, and Lugton Water. Ruins of Eglinton Castle. Visitor centre, play areas, and trim trail. Popular for walking, cycling, and horse riding. Regular events including Eglinton Tournament medieval festival. Dogs welcome. Excellent network of paths.
opening_hours: Park open 24/7. Visitor centre hours vary

name: EICA Ratho - Clip 'n Climb
description: Indoor adventure centre built in former quarry. Features Clip 'n Climb with colorful climbing walls and challenges suitable for all ages from 4+. Europe's largest indoor climbing arena. Also offers rock climbing, aerial adventure courses. Café on-site. Pre-booking essential. Great for active families.

name: Finlaystone House & Estate
description: Historic mansion house with beautiful gardens and woodland estate. Features gardens, woodland walks, play areas, Celtic art exhibition. Dolls' House collection. Ranger-led activities. Café serves home-baking. Dogs welcome in grounds. Popular for walks and family visits.
opening_hours: Grounds daily 10:30am-5pm. House tours limited days

name: Five Sisters Zoo
description: Scotland's only zoo dedicated exclusively to animal welfare, home to rescued and rehomed animals. Features big cats, primates, birds of prey, reptiles, and farm animals. Indoor tropical house. Play areas. Educational focus on animal rescue. Café on-site. Under 3s free. Allow 2-3 hours.

name: Flanders Moss National Nature Reserve
description: One of UK's largest lowland raised bogs. Important wildlife habitat with boardwalk trails through peatland. Excellent birdwatching including hen harriers, short-eared owls. Unique ecosystem with rare plants. Educational boards explain peat bog importance. Dogs not permitted to protect ground-nesting birds. Wear waterproof footwear.

name: Flip Out Trampoline Park
description: Large indoor trampoline park with main court, dodgeball, slam dunk, foam pits, and battle beams. Dedicated toddler sessions. Café serves food and refreshments. Popular for parties and active play. Pre-booking essential.

name: Free Wheel North
description: Bike hire facility at Glasgow Green offering standard bikes, tandems, kids bikes, and adapted cycles. Explore Glasgow's cycle paths and green spaces. Helmets and locks included. Popular for family cycling.

name: Fullarton Fairy Trail
description: Enchanting woodland trail with fairy doors, houses, and sculptures hidden among trees. Children love searching for magical features. Pleasant woodland walk suitable for families. Free entry.

name: Gambado Softplay
description: Large indoor adventure play centre with multi-level frames, ball pools, slides, and toddler areas. Sports activities and climbing. Café serves hot food. Popular for parties. Good rainy day option.

name: Garscube Playrooms
description: Indoor soft play centre with play frames, ball pools, and slides. Toddler area. Café serves refreshments. Party packages available.

name: Gatend Equestrian Centre
price: Ayrshire - horse riding, grooming etc. Weds & Fri, must book, £
description: Equestrian centre offering horse riding lessons, pony grooming sessions on Wednesdays and Fridays. Booking essential. Popular for birthday treats and learning to ride.

name: Glasgow Botanic Gardens & Kibble Palace
description: Beautiful 20-hectare botanic garden in Glasgow's West End featuring spectacular Victorian glasshouses, including the iconic Kibble Palace with its stunning collection of tree ferns. Tropical and temperate plant houses, systematic gardens, rose garden, and herb garden. Perfect for leisurely walks through manicured gardens and woodlands. Popular with families, students, and locals. Free entry to gardens and glasshouses. Dogs welcome on leads in outdoor areas. Adjacent to River Kelvin walkway. One of Glasgow's most loved green spaces.

name: Glasgow City Treasure Trail
description: Self-guided 2-mile treasure hunt starting at George Square. Download trail solving clues and discovering city history.

name: Glasgow Climbing Centre
description: Indoor climbing centre with walls for all abilities. Bouldering and top-rope climbing. Equipment hire and instruction available.

name: Glasgow Green
description: Glasgow's oldest public park (1450s) featuring People's Palace, Doulton Fountain, and Nelson's Monument. 55 hectares with walking paths and play areas.

name: Glasgow Museums Resource Centre
description: Unique visible storage facility with 400,000+ objects on open display. Behind-the-scenes access to Glasgow Museums collections.

name: Glasgow Sculpture Studios
description: Contemporary sculpture studio in Victorian whisky bond. Family workshops, gallery exhibitions. Accessible facilities.

name: Glasgow Ski & Snowboard Centre
description: UK's longest artificial ski slope (200m). Skiing and snowboarding lessons. Equipment hire. Floodlit evening sessions.

name: Glasgow West Treasure Trail
description: Self-guided 2-mile treasure hunt starting at Hillhead Underground exploring West End's Bohemian quarter.

name: Glazed Ceramics Studio
description: Pottery painting studio. Choose ceramics, paint, and collect when fired. Walk-in sessions available.

name: Go Wild Soft Play
description: Indoor soft play with multi-level frames, slides, ball pools. Toddler area. Café and party packages.

name: Gooey Events (Time to Slime)
description: Mobile slime-making parties and workshops. School visits and bookable events. All materials provided.

name: Gourock Outdoor Pool
description: Historic heated outdoor pool (1909) with Art Deco features. Stunning Clyde views. Summer season only.

name: Gravit8 Trampoline Park
description: Indoor trampoline park with dodgeball, foam pits, slam dunk. Toddler sessions available.

name: Green Aspirations
description: Outdoor activity centre offering forest school sessions and nature activities near Loch Lomond.

name: Greenbank Garden
description: 16-acre NTS walled garden demonstrating plants for Scottish climate. Tearoom, accessible paths.

name: Gruffalo Trail - Ardkinglas
description: 1-mile woodland trail with Gruffalo character sculptures. Set in estate with Britain's mightiest conifer.

name: Hamilton Water Palace
description: Indoor leisure pool with pirate ship, flumes, wave machine. Accessible facilities.

name: Happy Town NL
description: Indoor soft play with multi-level frames. Toddler area. Café and party packages.

name: Heads of Ayr Farm Park
description: Large farm park with Scotland's largest indoor play barn, outdoor playground, animals, tractor rides. Restaurant and gift shop.

name: Hollywood Bowl
description: Ten-pin bowling with bumpers for kids. Arcade and diner. Multiple locations.

name: Holmwood House
description: Historic house with seasonal opening. Managed by National Trust for Scotland.

name: I-Play Softplay
description: Indoor soft play centre with play equipment and facilities.

name: Inveraray Jail
description: Historic jail museum with interactive exhibits. Educational and entertaining for families.

name: Isle of Arran (Ferry Access)
location: Ardrossan to Brodick, Isle of Arran
description: Scotland's most accessible island, known as 'Scotland in Miniature' for its diverse landscapes including mountains, beaches, castles, and distillery. Ferry from Ardrossan (55 mins) or Lochranza-Claonaig. Features Brodick Castle and Gardens, Goat Fell mountain, coastal walks, beaches, wildlife spotting, Arran Distillery, and numerous outdoor activities. Perfect for day trips or longer stays. Dogs welcome on ferries and most outdoor areas.
opening_hours: Ferry sailings daily - check CalMac timetable

name: James Hamilton Heritage Park
description: Large country park centered around man-made loch. Walking and cycling paths, water sports (charges apply), adventure playground, mausoleum. Beautiful parkland popular with dog walkers, joggers, and families. Dogs welcome throughout.
opening_hours: Park open 24/7. Activity centre hours vary

name: Jeely Piece Club
description: Community play centre offering soft play and activities for children. Popular local facility. Party packages available.

name: Jolly Tots & Cookies Play Café
description: Play café with soft play area and café serving food. Toddler-friendly. Good for meeting friends while children play.

name: Jump-N-Joy Trampoline Park
description: Trampoline park with main court, dodgeball, foam pits. Toddler sessions available. Café serves refreshments. Accessible facilities. Popular for active play.

name: Jupiter Artland
description: Contemporary sculpture park with large-scale artworks by international artists set in 100 acres of beautiful parkland. Café serves seasonal food. Fascinating for art lovers. Allow 2-3 hours.

name: Jupiter Urban Wildlife Centre
description: Small nature reserve with pond, wildflower meadow, and woodland. Educational displays about urban wildlife. Good for short nature walks and wildlife watching. Free entry.

name: Jurassic Jungle Soft Play
description: Large dinosaur-themed soft play centre. Multi-level frames, slides, ball pools. Café serves hot food. Accessible facilities. Party packages available.

name: Jurassic Parrr Adventure Golf
description: Dinosaur-themed adventure golf course. 18 holes with dinosaur models and obstacles. Fun for families. Part of World of Golf complex.

name: Kelbourne Play Group
description: Community playgroup meeting Fridays 10am-12pm at Scout Hall. Toys, activities, refreshments. £2 per session. Great for meeting other parents and toddlers.

name: Kelburn Castle & Country Centre
description: Historic castle with famous graffiti art exterior. Beautiful grounds with forest trails, waterfalls, secret forest, bird sanctuary. Indoor and outdoor play areas including wooden adventure castle. Visitor centre, café. Dogs welcome in grounds. Unique combination of historic and contemporary. Allow 3-4 hours.

name: Kelvingrove Art Gallery & Museum
description: Scotland's most visited free attraction featuring 22 galleries displaying 8,000 objects including fine art, natural history, arms and armour, Ancient Egypt. Houses Salvador Dalí's 'Christ of St John of the Cross', Glasgow Boys paintings, Sir Roger the Asian elephant, and Spitfire. Magnificent 1901 pipe organ with daily recitals (1pm weekdays, 3pm Sundays). Discovery Centres for hands-on learning. Family-friendly with displays designed for children. Toddler group Fridays. Stunning Victorian architecture.
opening_hours: Mon-Thu & Sat 10am-5pm, Fri & Sun 11am-5pm. Closed 25-26 Dec, 1-2 Jan

name: Kelvingrove Park
description: Beautiful 34-hectare Victorian park in Glasgow's West End. Features River Kelvin walkway, skateboard park, bowling greens, tennis courts, play areas. Adjacent to Kelvingrove Museum. Popular for walks, picnics, sports. Dogs welcome. Accessible paths.

name: Kelvinhall Toddler Gym Time
description: Toddler gym sessions on Tuesdays and Fridays. Soft play equipment, balls, tunnels for active play in safe environment. Popular with parents of young children. Accessible facilities.

name: Kids Town Role Play
description: Indoor role play village where children explore different jobs and activities. Mini shops, hospital, fire station, café. Educational and fun. Popular for parties.

name: Kilmardinny Loch Gruffalo Hunt
description: Woodland walk around Kilmardinny Loch with Gruffalo hunt trail. Children search for Gruffalo characters hidden in trees. Pleasant circular walk suitable for buggies. Dogs welcome. Free activity perfect for families with young children.

name: King's Park
description: Large public park with adventure playground, walking paths, open green spaces. Good views over Stirling. Popular with local families for picnics and play. Dogs welcome.

name: Lake of Menteith & Inchmahome Priory
price: FREE loch access (ferry to priory charged)
description: Scotland's only natural lake (all others are lochs). Take ferry to Inchmahome Island to explore 13th-century Augustinian priory ruins where Mary Queen of Scots sought refuge as a child. Beautiful tranquil setting. Lakeshore walks free. Ferry seasonal. Managed by Historic Environment Scotland.

name: Lamont City Farm
description: Small community farm with friendly animals for petting including goats, sheep, rabbits, chickens. Free entry. Popular with young children. Volunteer-run facility. Great introduction to farm animals.

name: Lanark Equestrian Centre
description: Equestrian centre offering pony rides and riding lessons. Suitable for children and beginners. Booking required. Popular for birthday treats and learning to ride.

name: Landmark Adventure Park
description: Large adventure park in Highland setting. Features water rides, climbing towers, treetop trails, adventure playground. Steam train, butterfly house, exhibitions. Full day attraction. Dogs welcome in some outdoor areas.

name: Largs
description: Traditional Scottish seaside town with promenade, beach, shops, and cafés. Pencil Monument commemorating Battle of Largs. Ferry to Isle of Cumbrae. Vikingar! museum (charged). Beautiful seafront walks with views to Arran. Dogs welcome. Accessible promenade.

name: Linlithgow Canal Centre
description: Canal basin with boat trips on Union Canal. Narrow boat cruises through Scottish countryside. Café on-site. Museum about canal history. Pleasant canal-side walks. Popular for leisurely boat trips.
opening_hours: Seasonal - check for boat trip times

name: Linlithgow Palace
price: Adults and children charged, under 5s FREE
description: Magnificent ruined palace birthplace of Mary Queen of Scots. One of Scotland's finest Renaissance palaces. Explore grand halls, royal apartments, chapel. Beautiful lochside setting in Linlithgow Loch park. Managed by Historic Environment Scotland. Under 5s free. Allow 1-2 hours.

name: Linn Caves
description: Hidden caves in woodland setting reached by short walk. Interesting geological feature. Not suitable for very young children as requires scrambling. Dogs welcome. Free attraction for adventure-seeking families.

name: Linn Park
description: Historic 200-acre park featuring woodland walks, White Cart Water riverside paths, waterfalls, Cathcart Castle ruins, adventure playground. Linn House. Popular with families and dog walkers. Multiple entrances with free parking.

name: Linn Park Activity Centre
description: Activity centre in Glasgow's 200-acre Linn Park featuring woodland walks, riverside paths along White Cart Water, and waterfalls. Includes ruins of Cathcart Castle and Linn House. Popular with families and dog walkers.

name: Little Critters
description: Small animal attraction with reptiles, birds of prey, small mammals. Educational encounters with animals. Indoor and outdoor elements. Popular with children interested in wildlife.

name: Little Potters
description: Pottery painting studio where families paint ceramics. Choose from plates, mugs, figurines. Café below serves refreshments. Pieces fired and ready for collection. Popular creative activity.

name: Little World of Play
description: Indoor soft play centre with multi-level frames, slides, ball pools. Dedicated toddler area. Café serves hot food. Party packages available.

name: Loch Katrine
description: Beautiful freshwater loch in the Trossachs. Historic SS Sir Walter Scott steamship cruises (charged). Excellent cycling route (traffic-free) around loch. Café at pier. Stunning mountain scenery. Dogs welcome. Accessible paths at lochside. Popular for cycling, walking, and boat trips. Allow 2-3 hours minimum.

name: Loch Leven RSPB Reserve
description: Important nature reserve for breeding and migratory birds. Hides for birdwatching overlooking loch. Visitor centre with displays. Circular path around loch (13 miles). Dogs not permitted to protect birds. Excellent for wildlife enthusiasts.
opening_hours: Daily dawn to dusk. Visitor centre hours vary

name: Loch Lomond Faerie Trail
description: Woodland trail with fairy doors, houses, and characters hidden among trees. Children love searching for magical features. Set in beautiful Luss village on Loch Lomond shores. Low cost family activity.

name: Loch Lomond Shores
description: Gateway to Loch Lomond & Trossachs National Park. Shopping and leisure destination featuring SEA LIFE aquarium (charged), TreeZone aerial adventure (charged), shops, restaurants, visitor information. FREE outdoor adventure play park nearby in Balloch Country Park. Beautiful loch views, walking trails. Family-friendly with activities for all weathers.

name: Lollipop Land Soft Play
description: Indoor soft play with multi-level frames, slides, ball pools. Toddler area. Café serves hot food. Party packages available.

name: Low Parks Museum
description: Local museum in historic house featuring Hamilton history, Cameronians regiment displays, decorative arts. Regular temporary exhibitions. Free entry to permanent collections. Good for history enthusiasts.

name: Lunderston Bay
description: Popular shingle beach with stunning views across the Clyde. Coastal walks. Watersports including sailing, windsurfing. Picnic areas. Dogs welcome. Beautiful spot for beach walks and views.

name: M&D's Scotland's Theme Park
price: FREE entry - pay per ride or wristbands
description: Scotland's largest theme park with FREE entry and parking - pay only for rides used. Over 30 rides including roller coasters, log flume, 20+ kids' rides. Indoor: Amazonia (Scotland's only indoor rainforest), Krazy Congo soft play, Cosmic Bowl (glow bowling), adventure golf, arcade. Multiple restaurants. Theme park open mid-March to October, indoor attractions year-round. Most rides wheelchair-friendly. Free carers pass with NHS ID.
opening_hours: Theme park mid-March to October. Indoor year-round

name: Mabie Farm Park
description: Family farm with animals to meet and feed. Indoor and outdoor play areas. Tractor rides. Café serves food. Popular for family visits. Under 2s free entry.

name: Make Do & Grow
description: Community arts centre with free drop-in arts and crafts plus affordable creative workshops. Welcoming space for families. Materials provided. Great for creative activities on budget.

name: Maley's Artisan Chocolates
description: Chocolate-making and decorating classes for children and families. Weekend, holiday, and some mid-week sessions. Learn to make and decorate chocolates. Popular activity. Booking required.
opening_hours: Weekends, holidays, some mid-week - booking essential

name: Mariner Leisure Centre
description: Leisure centre with swimming pools, flume, gym facilities. Family swimming sessions. Popular for swimming and fitness.

name: Milk Barn
description: Ice cream parlour on working farm. Serves delicious farm-fresh ice cream and light meals. Outdoor tables. Dogs welcome in outdoor area. Popular stop for families.

name: Millport, Isle of Cumbrae
price: FREE beach (bike hire charged, ferry charged)
description: Charming island town perfect for family day trips. Famous for 10-mile circular road ideal for cycling - hire bikes at ferry terminal. Beautiful sandy beaches, Marine Station aquarium, Cathedral of the Isles (Britain's smallest cathedral). Crocodile Rock landmark. Ice cream shops, cafés. Ferry from Largs (10 mins). Dogs welcome. Accessible cycling route.

name: Mini Beatz Sensory Dance
description: Sensory dance classes for birth to preschool age. Music, movement, lights, bubbles. Engaging activities for young children. Classes across Glasgow and Airdrie locations.

name: Monkey Madness Soft Play
description: Large indoor soft play with multi-level frames, slides, ball pools. Dedicated toddler area. Café serves hot food. Accessible facilities. Party packages available.

name: Movement Park
description: Parkour and freerunning facility. Classes and open sessions for all abilities. Popular with active older children and teens. Coaching available.

name: Muddy Boots Farm
description: Family farm with animals to meet and feed. Play areas, tractor rides. Café serves food. Under 2s free. Popular for family visits.

name: Mugdock Country Park
description: Extensive 750-acre country park with woodland walks, open moorland, two castle ruins (Mugdock and Craigend). Visitor centres, ranger activities. Excellent walking and cycling. Garden centre on-site. Popular with families, dog walkers, mountain bikers. Stunning views. Some accessible paths.
opening_hours: Park open 24/7. Visitor centres hours vary

name: Muiravonside Country Park
description: Country park with woodland walks, River Avon, play areas. Visitor centre with exhibitions. Regular ranger-led activities and events. Dogs welcome. Popular for walks and family visits.
opening_hours: Park open 24/7. Visitor centre hours vary

name: Muirshiel Country Park
description: Large upland park with moorland walks, waterfalls, and hill summits. Ranger activities. Planetarium and astronomy centre. Excellent for walking and stargazing. Dogs welcome. Remote beautiful location.

name: Museum of Childhood
description: World's first museum dedicated to childhood history. Five floors of toys, games, books, childhood artifacts from 18th century to present. Nostalgic for adults, fascinating for children. Free entry. On historic Royal Mile.

name: Mystic Monkeys Soft Play
description: Indoor soft play with multi-level frames, slides, ball pools. Toddler area. Café serves food. Party facilities available.

name: National Museum of Flight
description: Scotland's national aviation museum on former RAF airfield. Extensive collection including Concorde, military jets, commercial aircraft, helicopters. Four hangars. Interactive displays, flight simulators. Under 5s free. Allow 2-3 hours. Excellent for aviation enthusiasts.

name: National Museum of Rural Life
description: Working farm and museum exploring Scotland's farming heritage. 1950s farm with animals, historic farmhouse, agricultural exhibits. Tractor rides, seasonal activities. Dogs welcome in outdoor areas. Under 5s free. Great for families interested in farming.

name: National Museum of Scotland
description: One of Scotland's top museums with vast collections spanning science, technology, natural history, world cultures, art, design, and Scottish history from prehistoric to present. Highlights: Dolly the Sheep, Egyptian mummies, Lewis Chessmen, Millennium Clock. Spectacular Victorian Grand Gallery and rooftop terrace with panoramic Edinburgh views. Interactive displays, Discovery Centres. Family activities and trails. Allow minimum 2-3 hours, could spend full day.

name: New Cumnock Outdoor Pool
description: Heated outdoor swimming pool. Open summer months. Popular for family swimming in outdoor setting.
opening_hours: Summer only - check for dates and times

name: New Lanark World Heritage Village
description: UNESCO World Heritage Site - beautifully preserved 18th-century cotton mill village. Visitor attractions (charged): Mill tour, Annie McLeod Experience, Robert Owen's House. FREE village access with stunning Falls of Clyde walks, play areas, mill lade walks. Restaurants, hotels, shops. Dogs welcome outdoors (not in indoor attractions). Accessible paths. Fascinating industrial heritage. Allow 3-4 hours.

name: Newark Castle
description: Well-preserved 15th-century castle on River Clyde. Explore tower house and hall. Managed by Historic Environment Scotland. Under 5s free. Good for history enthusiasts.

name: Newmilns Snow & Sports Complex
description: Indoor snow sports and activities centre. Skiing, snowboarding on indoor slope. Year-round winter sports. Equipment hire available.

name: Orcadia Trampoline Centre
description: Trampoline park with main court, dodgeball, foam pits. Popular for active play and parties. Pre-booking required.

name: Overtoun Park
description: Local park with play areas, walking paths, open green space. Popular with families and dog walkers. Free access.

name: Palace of Holyroodhouse
description: Official residence of British monarch in Scotland. Stunning State Apartments, Mary Queen of Scots chambers, ruins of Holyrood Abbey. Audio guide included. Beautiful gardens (summer only). At end of Royal Mile opposite Scottish Parliament. Under 5s free. Allow 1.5-2 hours.
opening_hours: Daily 9:30am-4:30pm (6pm summer), closed when royal family in residence

name: Palacerigg Country Park
description: 750-acre country park with native animal collection including deer, wildcats, bison, birds of prey. Children's play area, golf course, woodland walks. Visitor centre. Popular with families and wildlife enthusiasts. Dogs welcome. Accessible paths.
opening_hours: Park open dawn to dusk. Animal enclosures 10am-dusk

name: People's Palace & Winter Gardens
description: Museum telling story of Glasgow and its people from 1750 to present. Social history displays, working life, entertainment. Beautiful Victorian glasshouse Winter Gardens attached (currently closed for restoration - check before visiting). Free entry. On Glasgow Green.
opening_hours: Tue-Thu & Sat 10am-5pm, Fri & Sun 11am-5pm. Closed Mon

name: Pirate Pete's
description: Indoor soft play with pirate theme. Multi-level frames, slides, ball pools. Café serves food. Party packages available.

name: Platform @ Argyle St Arches
description: Street food market in railway arches. Independent food stalls. Open Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays. Some children's events. Vibrant atmosphere.

name: Plean Country Park
description: Country park with woodland walks, loch, play area. Popular for walking and picnics. Dogs welcome.

name: Police Museum
description: Small museum about Glasgow Police history. Exhibits of uniforms, equipment, crime history. Free entry. Interesting for history enthusiasts.

name: Polkemmet Country Park
description: Country park with woodland walks, children's play area, 9-hole golf course. One of three West Lothian country parks. Dogs welcome.

name: Pollok Country Park
price: FREE (Burrell Collection FREE, some activities paid)
description: Glasgow's largest park at 360 acres featuring Burrell Collection (art museum reopened 2022) and Pollok House (historic country house). Highland cattle grazing. Excellent paths for walking, cycling, horse riding. Adventure playground, woodland trails. One of Scotland's best urban green spaces.

name: Potter Around
description: Pottery painting studio. Choose ceramics to paint. Pieces fired and ready for collection. Popular creative activity.

name: Purves Puppets
description: Unique Victorian puppet theatre. Puppet shows and museum. Fascinating collection. Great for families.

name: Queen's Park & Glasshouse
description: Beautiful 60-hectare park with glasshouse, play areas, pond, and recreational facilities. Summit offers panoramic Glasgow views. Dogs welcome. Accessible paths.

name: Rainforest Adventure
description: Adventure golf courses with rainforest themes. Multiple locations. Fun for families.

name: Ravenscraig Activity Centre
description: Sports and activity centre. Various sports facilities and activities. Popular for active play.

name: Reidvale Adventure Play
description: Community adventure play centre. Low cost activities for children. Popular local facility.

name: Riverside Museum & Tall Ship
description: Award-winning transport museum by Zaha Hadid with 3,000+ objects including cars, trains, trams, bicycles, ship models. Recreated period streets. Adjacent Tall Ship Glenlee (1896). Interactive displays. One of Glasgow's top free attractions. Allow 2-3 hours.

name: Robert Burns Birthplace Museum
description: Flagship museum celebrating Scotland's National Bard with world's most important collection of Burns artefacts. Journey through beautiful Alloway village from museum to Burns Cottage where Robert was born in 1759, along Poet's Path to landmarks including Alloway Auld Kirk, Brig o' Doon, and Burns Monument. Interactive displays, costumed performers, Burns-themed play area (Scots Wa-Hey), café, gift shop. Winner of Scottish Thistle Awards Best Heritage Tourism Experience 2019/20. Managed by National Trust for Scotland.

name: Rock n Roller
description: Indoor roller skating rink offering public skating sessions, lessons, and party bookings. Skate hire available on site.

name: Roller Stop
description: Roller skating venue in Glasgow's Kinning Park area. Public skating sessions and parties available.

name: Rothesay Castle
description: Medieval castle with unique circular plan and water-filled moat. One of Scotland's most remarkable medieval castles, dating from the 13th century. Features impressive curtain walls, restored chapel, and great hall. Managed by Historic Environment Scotland.

name: Rouken Glen Park
description: Large park with play areas, walking trails, and open green spaces. Dogs welcome.

name: Rouken Glen Pottery
description: Pottery painting studio located near Rouken Glen Park. Choose from a wide selection of ceramics to paint and decorate. Great for families and creative activities.

name: RSPB Lochwinnoch
description: Nature reserve with hides overlooking wetlands. Excellent birdwatching including waders, wildfowl. Visitor centre with café and exhibitions. Nature trails. Dogs not permitted to protect wildlife. Popular with bird enthusiasts.

name: Ryze Trampoline Park
description: Trampoline park with various activities and party facilities.

name: Science Centre
description: Interactive science museum with hands-on exhibits for all ages. IMAX cinema available.

name: Scotkart
description: Go-kart racing venue with multiple locations. Fun for families and older children.

name: Scotland Street School
description: Historic school building designed by Charles Rennie Mackintosh. Museum of education.

name: Scottish Deer Centre
description: Deer park with various species. Feeding experiences and educational talks.

name: Scottish Football Museum
description: National museum dedicated to Scottish football history. Located at Hampden Park, Scotland's national stadium. Features extensive collection of memorabilia, interactive displays, and hall of fame. Stadium tours available.

name: Scottish Maritime Museum
price: Up to 3 kids FREE with paying adults
description: Maritime heritage museum with two locations showcasing Scotland's shipbuilding history. Historic vessels, shipyard worker's tenement flat, engine shop, and interactive displays. Family-friendly with hands-on exhibits.

name: Scottish Mask & Puppet Centre
description: Centre dedicated to masks and puppets with performances and workshops.

name: Scottish Owl Centre
description: Owl sanctuary with various owl species. Educational displays and handling experiences.

name: Scottish Parliament Building
description: Modern parliament building with guided tours and visitor facilities. Educational for families.

name: SEA LIFE Centre & Aquarium
description: Aquarium with marine life displays and interactive exhibits. Part of Loch Lomond Shores.

name: Sensory Room
description: Sensory room with lights, sounds, and tactile experiences. Great for children with sensory needs.

name: Sharmanka Kinetic Theatre
description: Unique mechanical theatre featuring hundreds of carved figures and pieces of scrap materials brought to life by light and music. Created by Russian sculptor-mechanic Eduard Bersudsky. Mesmerizing performances combining art, engineering, and storytelling. Booking essential.

name: Snow Factor
description: Indoor snow slope for skiing and snowboarding. Year-round winter sports.

name: Southerness Beach
description: Beautiful sandy beach on the Solway Coast with stunning views across to Cumbria. Popular for swimming, walking, and water sports. Lighthouse nearby. Dog-friendly year-round.

name: Sportsquad
description: Varied sports classes for 2-10 year olds. Multiple locations in East Dunbartonshire.

name: St Mungo's Museum of Religious Life & Art
description: Unique museum exploring religious life and art from around the world. Six major world religions represented through artifacts, art, and displays. Zen garden, Salvador Dali's Christ of St John of the Cross. Adjacent to Glasgow Cathedral. Part of Glasgow Museums.
opening_hours: Tue-Thu & Sat: 10am-5pm, Fri & Sun: 11am-5pm, Closed Mon

name: St. Andrew's Botanic Gardens
description: Beautiful botanic gardens with plant collections and walking paths. Dogs welcome.

name: Stirling Castle
description: One of Scotland's grandest castles, dominating a volcanic rock at the meeting point of Lowlands and Highlands. Key to the kingdom of Scotland, childhood home of Mary Queen of Scots. Stunning Great Hall, Royal Palace with Renaissance splendour, Chapel Royal, Regimental Museum, Great Kitchens, and tapestry studio. Costumed performers bring 16th-century life alive. Winner of multiple tourism awards. Managed by Historic Environment Scotland.
opening_hours: Apr-Sep: 9:30am-6pm; Oct-Mar: 9:30am-5pm (last entry 1hr before closing), Closed 25-26 Dec

name: Strathaven Park
description: Local park with play areas and walking paths. Dogs welcome.

name: Strathclyde Country Park
description: Large country park with loch, play areas, walking trails. Dogs welcome. Accessible paths.

name: Summerlee Heritage Centre
description: Industrial heritage museum with exhibits about local history and industry.

name: Tantallon Castle
description: Spectacular 14th-century clifftop fortress with breathtaking views of Bass Rock and North Sea. Last medieval curtain wall castle built in Scotland. Massive 50-foot high curtain wall blocking coastal promontory with sea cliffs on three sides. Stronghold of Red Douglas dynasty. Features Douglas Tower, pit prison, doocot, and dramatic history of sieges. Famous for possible ghost sightings. Managed by Historic Environment Scotland. Allow 1-2 hours.
opening_hours: Apr-Sep: 9:30am-5pm; Oct-Mar: 10am-4pm (last entry 30 mins before closing)

name: Tentsmuir
description: Nature reserve with beach, forest, and nature trails. Dogs welcome.

name: The Alpaca Trekking Centre
description: Unique outdoor experience walking with friendly alpacas through beautiful Scottish countryside. Various trek options available for all ages and abilities. Meet and greet sessions also available. Booking essential.

name: The Burrell Collection
description: World-renowned museum reopened in 2022 after major refurbishment. Houses 9,000-strong collection donated by shipping magnate Sir William Burrell including medieval art, Chinese ceramics, Islamic art, European paintings, and tapestries. Stunning architecture with glass walls bringing surrounding woodland inside. Free entry. Located in beautiful Pollok Country Park. Café with parkland views. Allow 2-3 hours. Excellent for art lovers and families.

name: The Children's Wood
description: Community woodland offering natural play and outdoor learning. Tree house, mud kitchen, campfire circle, and nature trails. Family-friendly events and workshops. Dogs welcome on leads.
opening_hours: Open daily - check for event times

name: The Craft Pottery
description: Pottery painting and ceramics studio. Choose from wide selection of pottery items to paint. Great for families, parties, and creative activities.

name: The Ecology Centre
description: Environmental education centre with interactive displays about ecology and sustainability. Hands-on activities for children, nature trails, and wildlife observation areas.

name: The Engine Shed
description: Conservation centre showcasing traditional building skills. Exhibitions about Scotland's built heritage, stone carving workshops, and craft demonstrations. Regular family events and activities. Educational and interesting for those interested in historic buildings and crafts. Café serves refreshments.

name: The Experience
description: Multi-activity venue offering soft play, sensory room, and various family activities. Popular for birthday parties and group bookings.

name: The Falkirk Wheel
description: World's only rotating boat lift connecting Forth & Clyde Canal with Union Canal. Engineering marvel and iconic Scottish landmark. Take boat trip through the wheel (charges apply). Visitor centre with exhibitions. Play areas, woodland walks, and canal-side paths. Café and gift shop. Free to visit and watch wheel operate. Dogs welcome in outdoor areas. Allow 1-2 hours (longer with boat trip).
opening_hours: Visitor centre daily 10am-5pm. Boat trips seasonal

name: The Gallery of Modern Art (GoMA)
description: Scotland's most visited modern art gallery housed in neoclassical building. Four galleries displaying contemporary art from local and international artists, including Turner Prize winners. Rotating exhibitions featuring post-1945 art: paintings, sculptures, installations, videos, digital art. Library, gift shop, café. Famous Duke of Wellington statue with traffic cone outside. Part of Glasgow Museums. Free admission.

name: The Kelpies & Helix Park
description: Scotland's iconic 30-metre-high horse head sculptures by Andy Scott. Set in 350-hectare Helix parkland with lagoon, walking/cycling paths, play areas. Visitor centre with exhibitions and café. Tower tours available (charged) for internal views. Beautiful at night when illuminated. Dogs welcome. Fully accessible. One of Scotland's most visited attractions. Free parking.

name: The Lighthouse
description: Scotland's Centre for Design and Architecture in former Glasgow Herald building - Charles Rennie Mackintosh's first public commission (1895). Mackintosh Interpretation Centre with interactive displays, original objects, and architectural models. Climb helical staircase in Mackintosh Tower for spectacular 360° Glasgow views. Exhibitions on design and architecture. Doocot café. Free admission. Part of Glasgow's Mackintosh Trail.
opening_hours: Check website for current opening times

name: The Lodge Forest Visitor Centre
description: Flagship visitor centre in Queen Elizabeth Forest Park with spectacular hillside views. Wildlife viewing room with live webcams of ospreys and red squirrels, dedicated red squirrel hide. Bluebell Café serves hot food. Starting point for waymarked walks (0.5-4 miles) and National Cycle Network Route 7. Home to UK's longest zip line (Go Ape, separate charge). Lumberjills memorial statue. Fully refurbished in 2013.

name: The Messy Place
description: Messy play sessions for young children. Sensory activities including paint, foam, and various textures. Pre-booking essential.

name: The Tall Ship at Riverside
description: Historic sailing ship Glenlee (1896) now museum ship. Explore three decks, learn about life at sea, maritime history. Small under-5s soft play area, café, gift shop. Free entry. Dogs welcome. Part of Riverside Museum complex.

name: The Wee Mud Hut
description: Pottery classes and workshops for all ages. Hand-building and wheel throwing available. Beginner-friendly with experienced instructors.

name: The ZooLab Jungle Room
description: Educational animal experience center. Meet and learn about various exotic animals including reptiles, insects, and small mammals. Seasonal opening (April-October).

name: Time Capsule
description: Leisure centre with swimming pools and water slides. Fun for families.

name: Tir Na Nog
description: Holistic centre with shop and café. Family-friendly venue.

name: Tollcross Farm
description: City farm with small animals for petting. Free entry. Dogs welcome.

name: Tree Stumps in Balloch Park
description: Natural play area with carved tree stumps for climbing and imaginative play within Balloch Castle Country Park. Part of beautiful parkland with loch views.
opening_hours: Park open daily dawn to dusk

name: Urban Gymnastics
description: Gymnastics classes for children of various ages and abilities.

name: Victoria Park
description: Park with fossil trees and play areas. Dogs welcome. Accessible paths.

name: Vikingar!
description: Viking heritage museum in Largs. Interactive exhibits about Viking history.

name: Wallace Monument
description: Historic monument with views over Stirling. Educational about Scottish history.

name: Waverley Excursions
description: Paddle steamer boat trips on the Clyde. Family-friendly river cruises.

name: Wellsfield Farm Park
description: Farm park with animals and play areas. Accessible facilities.

name: Whitelee Wind Farm
description: Visitor centre at wind farm with educational exhibits about renewable energy. Walking trails.

name: Wild Adventure Soft Play
description: Indoor soft play centre with play equipment and facilities.

name: Wonderworld Softplay
description: Soft play centre with multi-level frames and accessible facilities.

name: Woodland Fairy Experience
description: Woodland experience with fairy-themed activities. Includes refreshments.

name: World of Wings Birds of Prey Centre
description: Birds of prey centre with flying displays and static displays. Meet owls, hawks, eagles, and falcons. Educational talks and demonstrations. Photo opportunities.
opening_hours: Check for opening times and display schedules
